intro: Acronia penelops, commonly known as the coastal acronia, is a flowering plant native to the western coast of the United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Acronia penelops thrives in sandy or gravelly soils along coastal bluffs and dunes, often in areas with strong maritime influences. It is an important part of the local ecosystem, providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
